alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Ritchie (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 7:52PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ritchie and Doddridge Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pennsboro, or 8 miles east of Harrisville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pennsboro, West Union, Pullman, New Milton, Smithburg, Greenwood, Blandville, Berea, Avon, Canton and Grove. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 40 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
